Identification.LongTitle: Promotion of Tobacco Products and Accessories Regulations (Prohibited Terms)

Provision.Text: Whereas, pursuant to section 42.1 of the Tobacco Acta, the Minister of Health laid a copy of the proposed Promotion of Tobacco Products and Accessories Regulations (Prohibited Terms), substantially in the annexed form, before the House of Commons on June 9, 2011 and the House of Commons concurred on June 22, 2011 in a report from the Standing Committee on Health approving the proposed Regulations;

Therefore, His Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Minister of Health, pursuant to section 33b of the Tobacco Acta, hereby makes the annexed Promotion of Tobacco Products and Accessories Regulations (Prohibited Terms).

Section.Text: In these Regulations, cigarette includes any roll or tubular construction that contains tobacco and is intended for smoking, other than a bidi, cigar, kretek or tobacco stick.
The prohibitions in these Regulations that apply with respect to the terms “light” and “mild” also apply with respect to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: any variations in the spelling of those terms as well as the spelling of other parts of speech and grammatical forms of those terms; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: any modifiers of those terms, including “extra” and “ultra”, as well as any abbreviation of those terms or modifiers.

Section.MarginalNote: No promotion if terms on product

Subsection.Text: A person must not promote a bidi, cigarette, kretek, little cigar or tobacco stick or cigarette tobacco, cigarette papers, tubes or filters if the tobacco product displays the term “light” or “mild” or promote such a tobacco product by affixing to it the term “light” or “mild”.

Subsection.MarginalNote: No promotion if terms on packaging
Subsection.Text: A person must not promote a bidi, cigarette, kretek, little cigar or tobacco stick or cigarette tobacco, cigarette papers, tubes or filters if the package of the tobacco product displays the term “light” or “mild”.

Subsection.MarginalNote: No promotion if terms on accessories

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: an accessory that displays a brand element of a bidi, cigarette, kretek, little cigar or tobacco stick or cigarette tobacco, cigarette papers, tubes or filters if that accessory displays the term “light” or “mild”; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a bidi, cigarette, kretek, little cigar or tobacco stick or cigarette tobacco, cigarette papers, tubes or filters by affixing to an accessory a brand element of such a tobacco product if that accessory displays the term “light” or “mild”.

Section.MarginalNote: No advertising of product with terms
Section.Text: A person must not promote a bidi, cigarette, kretek, little cigar or tobacco stick, or cigarette tobacco, cigarette papers, tubes or filters by using the term “light” or “mild” in an advertisement of the tobacco product.

Section.MarginalNote: No packaging of products with terms
Section.Text: A person must not package a bidi, cigarette, kretek, little cigar or tobacco stick or cigarette tobacco, cigarette papers, tubes or filters, or have the tobacco product packaged by a third party, in a package that displays the term “light” or “mild”.

Section.MarginalNote: No sale of accessories with terms
Section.Text: A person must not sell an accessory that displays a brand element of a bidi, cigarette, kretek, little cigar or tobacco stick or cigarette tobacco, cigarette papers, tubes or filters if that accessory displays the term “light” or “mild”.

Section.MarginalNote: No retail display of products with terms

Subsection.Text: A person must not display, at retail, a bidi, cigarette, kretek, little cigar or tobacco stick or cigarette tobacco, cigarette papers, tubes or filters if the term “light” or “mild” is displayed on the tobacco product.

Subsection.MarginalNote: No retail display of accessories with terms
Subsection.Text: A person must not display, at retail, an accessory that displays a brand element of a bidi, cigarette, kretek, little cigar or tobacco stick or cigarette tobacco, cigarette papers, tubes or filters if that accessory displays the term “light” or “mild”.
Subject to subsection (2), these Regulations come into force on the day on which they are registered.
Sections 6 and 7 come into force on the day that is four months after the day on which these Regulations are registered.
